UPNW Train #667 Delayed

UPNW train #667 scheduled to arrive Crystal Lake at 8:00 PM, may be operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule, due to track construction and signal issues. Visit metratracker.com for the location of your train.

Metra Electric - 79th Street/Chatham Station
The 79th Street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric may not be fully ADA accessible Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

Metra Electric - 103rd St./Rosemoor Station ADA Accessibility.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 103rd St,/Rosemoor station may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - The 95th St/Chicago State University station will close March 3, 2025 - Station Rehab and Expansion Project

On Monday, March 3, the 95th st/Chicago State University station will close for approximately 2 years to undergo a rehabilitation and expansion project. During this time passengers should use 91st street and 103rd st/Rosemoor stations as alternates. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  103rd St./Rosemoor Station ADA Accessibility.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 103rd St,/Rosemoor station may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Beginning May 9, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station Reconstruction

Beginning May 9, 2025, the 115th Street Morgan Park Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station reconstruction. Full site construction is expected to continue through Spring 2026. An accessible alternative is the 111th Street Morgan Park Station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - Beginning June 2, 2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction.

Beginning June 2,2025, the Pingree Station will be temporarily inaccessible to ADA users due to station construction. ADA access will resume late 2025. Passengers requiring full accessibility should use Crystal Lake station. Metra will provide updates once accessibility is fully restored.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Michigan and Randolph Elevator Out of Service

The Michigan Avenue elevator located on the southwest corner of Michigan and Randolph is permanently out of service. Customers can use the South Water elevator, 225 N Michigan Avenue, or McCormick Place as an alternate boarding station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Morton Grove Partial Parking Outage

Due to ongoing construction of the new Morton Grove Metra Station and temporary reduction of the site's accessory parking, an existing 105-space municipal parking lot located at 8550 Lehigh Avenue will be made available to the public for permit parking starting August 1, 2025, through October 31, 2025. Click here for more details.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - UPNW Update - Notice of Construction Monday, August 4 through Thursday, October 9

Effective August 4 through October 9: Weekday and weekend construction occurring between Irving Park to Edison Park for a tie project.  Midday trains (In: 636-660 / Out: 613-637) may experience delays up to 25 minutes.  Trains (630, 632, 634) may also experience delays up to 5 minutes.  Due to this construction, the following UPNW trains #648 (departs Crystal Lake 11:45am), #654 (departs Crystal Lake 2:45pm), 621 (departs OTC 9:35am), 627 (departs OTC 12:35pm) will be cancelled for the duration of the project.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Northbrook Platform Rehabilitation

Phase 1- Beginning the first week of September, the Outbound Platform north of Shermer Road and part of the Outbound Platform south of Shermer Road will be out of service for approximately 2 weeks for rehabilitation.

Phase 2-  After completion, the remaining part of the Outbound Platform south of Shermer Road will be out of service for approximately 2 weeks to complete the rehabilitation project. The pedestrian crosswalk will remain in service for the primary duration of work.

Metra will update this station with additional information as it becomes available. We apologize for any inconvenience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Games at Soldier Field
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for Chicago home games at Soldier Field. For more information click here and visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - University Park Station Parking Lot Entry Canopies Refurbished

University Park Station parking lot entry canopies will be refurbished from October 6 through Winter 2026.

Passengers will not have access to the West parking Lot platform entry from October 6 through end of November. Upon completion, passengers will not have access to the East Parking Lot platform entry through Winter 2026. During these closures passengers should use the opposite parking lot for all access.

Customers are encouraged to use Richton Park for full access during the construction period.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME -  87th Street/Woodruff Station will reopen on October 6, 2025.

On October 6, 2025, 87th Street/Woodruff will reopen.  Please look and listen for announcements— Some trains may not be able to board customers requiring accessibility between 9am and 4pm, Monday through Friday.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-N - Ogilvie Transportation Center Gate Board Replacement

Beginning Monday, Sept. 22, the large gate boards located on the east and west walls at Ogilvie Transportation Center will be replaced and upgraded over the next few weeks. Throughout this project, atleast one gate board will remain operational at all times to ensure riders have access to train information. Metra will provide updates as information becomes available.
